alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 7:03AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Interior Sonoma County in northern California. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 AM PDT, gauge reports indicated Green Valley Creek at Martinelli Road is in minor flood stage, and Mark West Creek near Mirabel Heights is in monitor stage. With showers and isolated thunderstorms expected through the day, poor- drainage and small stream flooding is expected through this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Rohnert Park, Sebastopol, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
